717789f-a.text:
4460-4466 Broadway at the N.E. corner of Fairview Avenue, between
190th and 192nd Streets.
About 1925.
General Photographic Company.

719725f-a.text:
Broadway (street level not seen, being between buildings and hillock) at Fairview Avenue, as viewed from Wadsworth Terrace and across intervening roof tops. The intervening roof tops with clothes lines and drying laundry are associated with a number of four story buildings fronting on Broadway Terrace. Shown atop the bluff are: the castlelike structure of Dr. Chas V. Paterno; the studio of Geo. Barnard Grey; and the mansion and estate of C.N.G. Billings. The
latter is today apart of Fort Tryon Park.
October 26, 1927.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr

717787f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway at, adjoining, and south of the S.W. corner of 190th Street. The Cloisters and the George Grey Barnard Studio are seen
in the background.
Novcmber 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, seen from the street level.
November 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
